meanings.definition: A group of extinct marine mollusks with spiral shells.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the ancient ammonoids found in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of well-preserved ammonoids.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be playful sea creatures like the fascinating ammonoids.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts spiraled like the intricate shells of the ancient ammonoids.
meanings.sent5: The diver marveled at the beauty of the delicate ammonoids.

meanings.sent1: The paleontologist carefully extracted the fragile ammonoids from the rock.
meanings.sent2: The museum exhibit showcased a variety of perfectly preserved ammonoids.
meanings.sent3: The fossilized ammonoids seemed to whisper secrets of the past to the curious researcher.
meanings.sent4: The ancient city was buried under layers of time, like the hidden treasure of the fossilized ammonoids.
meanings.sent5: The collector's prized possession was a rare and valuable piece of fossilized ammonoids.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or resembling these mollusks.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful painting inspired by the ammonoids' unique shapes.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry designer crafted a necklace with intricate patterns reminiscent of the elegant ammonoids.
meanings.sent3: The room was decorated with ammonoids-themed decorations for the marine-themed party.
meanings.sent4: Her flowing dress swirled around her like the graceful movements of the ammonoids in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with plants that bore a striking resemblance to the ammonoids' spiral shells.
